snippet: Los Angeles filed suit on Thursday against developer of the Da Vinci Apartments, alleging improper construction and security led to damage of city buildings when arson nearly destroyed the complex.
abstract: Los Angeles files $20 million lawsuit against developer Geoffrey H Palmer and his GH Palmer Associates, accusing company of negligence in its construction of Da Vinci Apartments; apartments were set ablaze by taxi driver Dawud Abdulwali in 2014, and fire spread and damaged nearby city buildings.
lead_paragraph: Los Angeles filed suit on Thursday against developer of the Da Vinci Apartments, alleging improper construction and security led to damage of city buildings when arson nearly destroyed the complex.

headline.main: California: Developer Sued for $20 Million in Fire
headline.print_headline: California: Developer Sued for $20 Million in Fire
